verses.verse: A good <S%H8034>name<s%> is rather to be <S%H977>chosen<s%> than <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H6239>riches<s%>, and <S%H2896>loving<s%> <S%H2580>favour<s%> rather than <S%H3701>silver<s%> and <S%H2091>gold<s%>.
The <S%H6223>rich<s%> and <S%H7326>poor<s%> meet <S%H6298>together<s%>: the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is the <S%H6213>maker<s%> of them all.
A <S%H6175>prudent<s%> man <S%H7200>foreseeth<s%> the <S%H7451>evil<s%>, and <S%H5641%H5641>hideth<s%> himself: but the <S%H6612>simple<s%> pass <S%H5674>on<s%>, and are <S%H6064>punished<s%>.
<S%H6118>By<s%> <S%H6038>humility<s%> and the <S%H3374>fear<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> are <S%H6239>riches<s%>, and <S%H3519>honour<s%>, and <S%H2416>life<s%>.
<S%H6791>Thorns<s%> and <S%H6341>snares<s%> are in the <S%H1870>way<s%> of the <S%H6141>froward<s%>: he that doth <S%H8104>keep<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%> shall be <S%H7368>far<s%> from them.
Train <S%H2596>up<s%> a <S%H5288>child<s%> in the <S%H1870>way<s%> he should <S%H6310>go<s%>: and when he is <S%H2204>old<s%>, he will not <S%H5493>depart<s%> from it.
The <S%H6223>rich<s%> <S%H4910>ruleth<s%> over the <S%H7326>poor<s%>, and the <S%H3867>borrower<s%> is <S%H5650>servant<s%> to the <S%H376%H3867>lender<s%>.
He that <S%H2232>soweth<s%> <S%H5766>iniquity<s%> shall <S%H7114>reap<s%> <S%H205>vanity<s%>: and the <S%H7626>rod<s%> of his <S%H5678>anger<s%> shall <S%H3615>fail<s%>.
He that hath a <S%H2896>bountiful<s%> <S%H5869>eye<s%> shall be <S%H1288>blessed<s%>; for he <S%H5414>giveth<s%> of his <S%H3899>bread<s%> to the <S%H1800>poor<s%>.
Cast <S%H1644>out<s%> the <S%H3887>scorner<s%>, and <S%H4066>contention<s%> shall go <S%H3318>out<s%>; yea, <S%H1779>strife<s%> and <S%H7036>reproach<s%> shall <S%H7673>cease<s%>.
He that <S%H157>loveth<s%> <S%H2890%H2889>pureness<s%> of <S%H3820>heart<s%>, for the <S%H2580>grace<s%> of his <S%H8193>lips<s%> the <S%H4428>king<s%> shall be his <S%H7453>friend<s%>.
The <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H5341>preserve<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>, and he <S%H5557>overthroweth<s%> the <S%H1697>words<s%> of the <S%H898>transgressor<s%>.
The <S%H6102>slothful<s%> man <S%H559>saith<s%>, There is a <S%H738>lion<s%> <S%H2351>without<s%>, I shall be <S%H7523>slain<s%> <S%H8432>in<s%> the <S%H7339>streets<s%>.
The <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of strange <S%H2114>women<s%> is a <S%H6013>deep<s%> <S%H7745>pit<s%>: he that is <S%H2194>abhorred<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall <S%H5307>fall<s%> therein.
<S%H200>Foolishness<s%> is <S%H7194>bound<s%> in the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of a <S%H5288>child<s%>; but the <S%H7626>rod<s%> of <S%H4148>correction<s%> shall drive it <S%H7368>far<s%> from him.
He that <S%H6231>oppresseth<s%> the <S%H1800>poor<s%> to <S%H7235>increase<s%> his riches, and he that <S%H5414>giveth<s%> to the <S%H6223>rich<s%>, shall surely come to <S%H4270>want<s%>.
Bow <S%H5186>down<s%> thine <S%H241>ear<s%>, and <S%H8085>hear<s%> the <S%H1697>words<s%> of the <S%H2450>wise<s%>, and <S%H7896>apply<s%> thine <S%H3820>heart<s%> unto my <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>.
For it is a pleasant <S%H5273>thing<s%> if thou <S%H8104>keep<s%> them <S%H990>within<s%> thee; they shall <S%H3162>withal<s%> be <S%H3559>fitted<s%> in thy <S%H8193>lips<s%>.
That thy <S%H4009>trust<s%> may be in the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, I have made <S%H3045>known<s%> to thee this <S%H3117>day<s%>, even to thee.
Have not I <S%H3789>written<s%> to <S%H8032>thee<s%> excellent <S%H7991>things<s%> in <S%H4156>counsels<s%> and <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>,

That I might make thee <S%H3045>know<s%> the <S%H7189>certainty<s%> of the <S%H561>words<s%> of <S%H571>truth<s%>; that thou mightest <S%H7725>answer<s%> the <S%H561>words<s%> of <S%H571>truth<s%> to them that <S%H7971>send<s%> unto thee?
<S%H1497>Rob<s%> not the <S%H1800>poor<s%>, because he is <S%H1800>poor<s%>: neither <S%H1792>oppress<s%> the <S%H6041>afflicted<s%> in the <S%H8179>gate<s%>:
For the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> will <S%H7378>plead<s%> their <S%H7379>cause<s%>, and <S%H6906>spoil<s%> the <S%H5315>soul<s%> of those that <S%H6906>spoiled<s%> them.
Make no <S%H7462>friendship<s%> with an <S%H639>angry<s%> <S%H1167>man<s%>; and with a <S%H2534>furious<s%> <S%H376>man<s%> thou shalt not <S%H935>go<s%>:
Lest thou <S%H502>learn<s%> his <S%H734>ways<s%>, and <S%H3947>get<s%> a <S%H4170>snare<s%> to thy <S%H5315>soul<s%>.
Be not thou one of them that <S%H8628>strike<s%> <S%H3709>hands<s%>, or of them that are <S%H6148>sureties<s%> for <S%H4859>debts<s%>.
If thou hast nothing to <S%H7999>pay<s%>, why should he take <S%H3947>away<s%> thy <S%H4904>bed<s%> from under thee?
<S%H5253>Remove<s%> not the <S%H5769>ancient<s%> <S%H1366>landmark<s%>, which thy <S%H1>fathers<s%> have <S%H6213>set<s%>.

<S%H2372>Seest<s%> thou a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H4106>diligent<s%> in his <S%H4399>business<s%>? he shall <S%H3320>stand<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H4428>kings<s%>; he shall not <S%H3320>stand<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H2823>mean<s%> men.
